medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started with a headache 3 days ago, which worsened then improved. Abdominal pain started yesterday, diffuse and in the lower abdomen, and has since localized to the right upper quadrant. Nausea present with one episode of nonbloody, nonbilious vomiting. Reports chills at home and denies fever. Denies pain similar to her reflux pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic adrenal insufficiency (Addison's disease), diabetes mellitus type 2, hyperlipidemia, hypertension, gastroesophageal reflux disease, cataracts, glaucoma.
